simple.annotation: Days of the edict duration. If 0, this Edict immediately ends. If -1, this Edict lasts until manually toggled off.

complex.annotation: An Economy Unit that determines the cost of this edict. Only the "cost" field is wanted. If length is -1, the cost is paid again when deactivating.

list.annotation: A list of Technology keys that determines the technology prerequisites of this edict

complex.annotation: A block of Conditions. If evaluated false, this edict will not be shown in the technology tooltip of that technology.
A block of Modifiers to be applied to the empire for as long as this edict remain active.
A block of Conditions that determines is this edict listed for this empire. (Country scope)
A block of Conditions that determines can this edict be activated by this empire. (Country scope)

list.annotation: A block of Effects to be executed when this edict become active. (Country scope)

simple.annotation: The number of Edict Capacities this Edict will use.

complex.annotation: The higher it is, the more likely the AI will try to activate this edict.
A block of Conditions to determine is an empire able to see this policy. If an empire can't see a policy, it won't have any of its options active.
A block of Conditions to determine is an empire able to change this policy. Vanilla use this to prevent switching diplomatic stance and war philosophy during a war
An instance that adds an option to this policy. Multiple allowed. A policy should have at least one valid option for each empire.

simple.annotation: A localisation key that determines the name and description of this option
A reference to a GFX entry that determines the icon of this option. Only diplomatic stance has this. Other policy options will never have their icons displayed

list.annotation: A list of strings to be checked by the condition has_policy_flag. A policy option without any policy flags can't be checked by Conditions

complex.annotation: A block of Modifiers that applies to the empire with this option active.
